likedActivities.name: Visit Kyoto's Kinkaku-ji (Golden Pavilion)
likedActivities.whyRecommended: Kinkaku-ji, with its stunning gold leaf exterior, reflects beautifully in the surrounding pond. Visiting in the morning allows you to experience the tranquility of the gardens before the crowds arrive.
likedActivities.practicalInfo: Entry fee is around ¥400. Accessible by bus from Kyoto Station.

likedActivities.name: Savor Traditional Kaiseki Dinner
likedActivities.whyRecommended: Kaiseki is a multi-course dining experience that showcases seasonal ingredients and local flavors. It’s an artful expression of Japanese cuisine and culture that’s best enjoyed in the evening.
likedActivities.practicalInfo: Reservations recommended; prices vary from ¥5,000 to ¥15,000 depending on the restaurant.

likedActivities.name: Hike in the Japanese Alps
likedActivities.whyRecommended: The Japanese Alps offer breathtaking views and a variety of trails for all skill levels. Summer is an excellent time for hiking, with lush greenery and cooler temperatures at higher altitudes.
likedActivities.practicalInfo: Access via train to Matsumoto; consider staying overnight for more trails.

likedActivities.name: Take Part in a Tea Ceremony
likedActivities.whyRecommended: Participating in a traditional tea ceremony allows you to immerse yourself in Japanese culture and appreciate the artistry of tea preparation. It's a peaceful experience that showcases mindfulness.
likedActivities.practicalInfo: Most tea houses require advance booking; prices start around ¥2,000.

dislikedActivities.name: Explore Nara Park and Todai-ji Temple
dislikedActivities.whyRecommended: Home to free-roaming deer and the Great Buddha, Nara Park offers a unique blend of nature and history. Strolling through the park allows for close encounters with wildlife and breathtaking temple architecture.
dislikedActivities.practicalInfo: Free entry to the park; Todai-ji Temple entrance fee is ¥600. Easily reachable by train from Kyoto.

dislikedActivities.name: Attend a Summer Matsuri (Festival)
dislikedActivities.whyRecommended: Japan's summer festivals are vibrant showcases of local culture, featuring traditional performances, food stalls, and fireworks. This period is filled with lively celebrations across various cities.
dislikedActivities.practicalInfo: Check local schedules for specific festivals; usually free to attend.

dislikedActivities.name: Relax at an Onsen (Hot Spring)
dislikedActivities.whyRecommended: Experience the rejuvenating benefits of Japan's natural hot springs, known for their healing properties. Summer offers a unique chance to enjoy outdoor baths surrounded by nature.
dislikedActivities.practicalInfo: Entry fees range from ¥1,000 to ¥3,500. Popular onsens may require prior booking.

dislikedActivities.name: Visit Tokyo Tower
dislikedActivities.whyRecommended: Tokyo Tower offers panoramic views of the metropolis, especially beautiful at sunset. The experience is iconic and provides a great photo opportunity.
dislikedActivities.practicalInfo: Entry fee is around ¥1,200. Located in Minato, easily accessible via public transport.

dislikedActivities.name: Explore the Streets of Gion District
dislikedActivities.whyRecommended: Gion is famous for its traditional wooden machiya houses and geisha culture. Strolling through its streets in the evening gives you a glimpse of old Kyoto and the chance to spot geishas.
dislikedActivities.practicalInfo: Free to explore; guided tours are available for a fee.

destination: Rome, Metropolitan City of Rome Capital, Italy

likedActivities.name: Visit the Colosseum and Roman Forum
likedActivities.whyRecommended: As one of the most iconic landmarks in the world, the Colosseum offers a glimpse into ancient Roman architecture and gladiatorial games. The adjacent Roman Forum allows visitors to wander through the ruins of what was once the heart of ancient Rome.
likedActivities.practicalInfo: Tickets can be purchased online in advance to avoid long lines. Entry costs around €18. Arrive early to enjoy a less crowded experience.

likedActivities.name: Cooking Class: Make Authentic Italian Pasta
likedActivities.whyRecommended: This hands-on class allows you to learn from local chefs how to create traditional Roman pasta dishes. It's both fun and educational, perfect for food lovers.
likedActivities.practicalInfo: Classes usually require advance booking, with prices around €70 per person. Various locations throughout the city offer this experience.

likedActivities.name: Stroll through Trastevere
likedActivities.whyRecommended: Trastevere is known for its charming streets, vibrant atmosphere, and authentic Roman dining. It's a perfect spot for a leisurely walk and to soak in local life.
likedActivities.practicalInfo: This area is pedestrian-friendly and easily accessible via public transport. Enjoy dinner at one of the many trattorias for a true taste of Rome.

likedActivities.name: Visit the Pantheon
likedActivities.whyRecommended: The Pantheon is one of the best-preserved monuments of ancient Rome and a remarkable example of Roman engineering. Its massive dome and oculus are fascinating to explore.
likedActivities.practicalInfo: Entry is free, but consider visiting early afternoon when it tends to be less crowded. Located in the heart of the city, it's also close to many other attractions.

likedActivities.name: Visit the Colosseum and Roman Forum
likedActivities.whyRecommended: As one of the most iconic landmarks in the world, the Colosseum offers a glimpse into ancient Roman architecture and gladiatorial games. The adjacent Roman Forum allows visitors to wander through the ruins of what was once the heart of ancient Rome.
likedActivities.practicalInfo: Tickets can be purchased online in advance to avoid long lines. Entry costs around €18. Arrive early to enjoy a less crowded experience.

dislikedActivities.name: Relax at Villa Borghese Gardens
dislikedActivities.whyRecommended: These beautiful gardens provide a serene escape from the bustling city. Enjoy a leisurely walk, rent a bike, or even take a boat out on the small lake.
dislikedActivities.practicalInfo: Entry to the gardens is free, but renting bikes or boats incurs a small fee. Don't forget to visit the Borghese Gallery for its impressive art collection (ticket required).

dislikedActivities.name: Attend an Opera at Teatro dell'Opera di Roma
dislikedActivities.whyRecommended: Experiencing a live opera performance in one of Rome's historic theaters offers a unique cultural experience. The combination of beautiful music and stunning architecture makes for a memorable evening.
dislikedActivities.practicalInfo: Tickets can be purchased online or at the box office. Prices vary depending on the seat, starting around €30.

dislikedActivities.name: Gelato Tasting Tour
dislikedActivities.whyRecommended: Indulge in Italy's most famous dessert with a guided gelato tasting tour. You'll learn about the history and making process while sampling from some of the best gelaterias in Rome.
dislikedActivities.practicalInfo: Book in advance for a group or private tour, typically costing around €45 per person. The tour covers several neighborhoods, making it a delightful way to explore.

likedActivities.name: Glacier Bay National Park Kayaking Tour
likedActivities.whyRecommended: Glacier Bay is a UNESCO World Heritage Site that features stunning glacial vistas and rich marine life. Paddling through the tranquil waters allows you to get close to icebergs and possibly spot seals and sea lions. This immersive experience connects you with Alaska's untouched beauty.
likedActivities.practicalInfo: Kayaking tours depart from Gustavus; make reservations in advance. Costs range from $120-$200 per person.

likedActivities.name: Alaskan Seafood Cooking Class
likedActivities.whyRecommended: Learn to prepare traditional Alaskan dishes using fresh, locally sourced seafood. This hands-on class not only teaches you fantastic recipes but also shares the cultural significance of Alaskan cuisine, making it a deliciously educational experience.
likedActivities.practicalInfo: Classes are held in Anchorage; pre-booking is essential. Prices range from $85 to $120 per person.

dislikedActivities.name: Denali National Park Wildlife Tour
dislikedActivities.whyRecommended: Experience the breathtaking landscapes and diverse wildlife of Denali National Park. With the peak of summer in August, it's the ideal time to spot grizzly bears, moose, and caribou in their natural habitat. The park's majestic views and vast wilderness offer a remarkable adventure for nature enthusiasts.
dislikedActivities.practicalInfo: Tours typically depart from Talkeetna or Anchorage; advance booking is recommended. Costs range from $150-$250 per person.

dislikedActivities.name: Alaska Native Heritage Center
dislikedActivities.whyRecommended: The Alaska Native Heritage Center offers a deep dive into the rich cultures and histories of Alaska's Indigenous people. With engaging exhibits and live performances, this center promotes a deeper understanding of the local heritage and traditions.
dislikedActivities.practicalInfo: Located in Anchorage; tickets are about $20 for adults. Check for guided tours available on specific days.
